content:
The standard describes requirements, specifications and test-methods for clocks, watches and their components.

|   Section | Changes                                                                        |
|----------:|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     nan   | Updated standard format and wording.                                           |
|       1   | Battery requirements differentiated for wall hanging and free standing clocks. |
|       2.1 | Approved clock movements (Table 3) updated.                                    |

Page 1/4

Edition 2 â€“ 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Clocks must comply with Table 1.

Clocks must be battery driven. Pi cannty Rationale: Clocks supplied by mains electricity require extensive testing to show compliance with the Low Voltage Pply Directive (LVD). Testing would as a minimum include the harmonized standards EN 60335-1 and EN 60335-2-26.

e Must not be included with the product. e The type and amount of battery must be stated on the packaging. Use of â€˜alkalineâ€™ batteries must be advised in the supplied instructions.

Change The product must be designed to allow easy change of batteries of Construction i . batteries | requirements

The battery compartment must be directly accessible or accessible without use of tools. Free standing clocks | The battery compartment design must comply with JYSK 4005. Products using the radio frequency spectrum are not permitted. Rationale: Products that use the radio frequency spectrum require extensive testing to show compliance with the Radio Equipment Directive (RED). Loudness must be specified in the format [dB(A) @ 10 cm] Permitted range: 60-90 Tolerance: Less than +3

Wall hanging clocks must include a â€˜keyholeâ€™ or similar shaped recess for hanging. ging

wall ti mounting The internal recess edge must be <4 mm from the plane that contacts with the wall.

Sharp edges p eag

Accessible sharp edges are not permitted. Terminals

in the battery compartment are omitted regarded they do not pose a safety risk. Nominal Minimum

(When included)

Page 2/4

Analog clocks must comply with Table 2.

The standard describes requirements, specifications and test-methods for clocks, watches and their components.

Section Changes Updated standard format and wording. All Updated tables and references. Old chapter 2.3 regarding watches removed. Old chapter 3/3.1 merged with 2.1. 1 Battery requirements differentiated for wall hanging and free standing clocks. 2.1 Approved clock movements (Table 3) updated.
Edition 2 â€“ 2022-04 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
Clocks must comply with Table 1.

Clocks must be battery driven. Pi cannty Rationale: Clocks supplied by mains electricity require extensive testing to show compliance with the Low Voltage Pply Directive (LVD). Testing would as a minimum include the harmonized standards EN 60335-1 and EN 60335-2-26.
e Must not be included with the product. e The type and amount of battery must be stated on the packaging. Use of â€˜alkalineâ€™ batteries must be advised in the supplied instructions.
Change The product must be designed to allow easy change of batteries of Construction i . batteries | requirements

The battery compartment must be directly accessible or accessible without use of tools. Free standing clocks | The battery compartment design must comply with JYSK 4005. Products using the radio frequency spectrum are not permitted. Rationale: Products that use the radio frequency spectrum require extensive testing to show compliance with the Radio Equipment Directive (RED). Loudness must be specified in the format [dB(A) @ 10 cm] Permitted range: 60-90 Tolerance: Less than +3
Wall hanging clocks must include a â€˜keyholeâ€™ or similar shaped recess for hanging. ging
wall ti mounting The internal recess edge must be <4 mm from the plane that contacts with the wall.
Sharp edges p eag
Accessible sharp edges are not permitted. Terminals in the battery compartment are omitted regarded they do not pose a safety risk. Nominal Minimum

Examples Crystal oscillator 32,768 kHz Battery type for clock movement 1 x 1,5 V AA battery Operation voltage 1,3 ~ 1,7 V Operation temperature -10Â°C ~ 50Â°C Current consumption â‰¤200 Î¼A at 1,5V DC Must be sweep and not noisy. Only approved movements according to Table 3 must be used - Use of other movements must be approved by JYSK C&Q.
